title: President Biden Remembers Queen Elizabeth II Who ‘Defined an Era’
description: Biden first met Queen Elizabeth in 1982 during a trip to Britain as a young senator. His most recent meeting came about a year ago, in Cornwall, England.

title: Grief for the Queen Mixes With Criticism of the Monarchy
description: Queen Elizabeth II was remembered by ordinary Britons, world leaders and other royals for her grace, humor and longevity. Others had more conflicted views on the monarchy, opening a tense divide.

title: The Queen Met 13 Sitting U.S. Presidents, Who Basked in Her Global Prestige
description: Queen Elizabeth II was a gracious host and guest over the last seven decades, even when faced with protocol mistakes and awkward missteps.

title: In a Divided Britain, Near Unity in Admiration of the Queen
description: Across London, conversations reflected how deeply the loss had touched the nation — and how fundamental Elizabeth’s role had been in the national identity.

title: Queen Elizabeth’s Death Comes at Moment of Uncertainty for Britain
description: There is no analogous British figure who will be mourned as deeply, or whose death will provoke a greater reckoning with the identity and future of the country.

title: A Kick at the Door, a Knife in the Hand: The Saskatchewan Murders
description: As investigators pore over a sprawling and complex trail of crimes, a clearer picture is emerging of the stabbing rampage on an Indigenous reserve in Canada.

title: In a Surprise Visit to Ukraine, Blinken Offers Aid and Encouragement
description: At a “pivotal moment” as a counteroffensive makes gains, the secretary of state pledged $2.8 billion more in military aid to Ukraine and allies.

title: Mourning Queen Elizabeth II, in Photos
description: The death of the queen marks the loss of a revered monarch, the only one most Britons have ever known.

title: Biden and Former Presidents Give Statements on Queen Elizabeth II
description: Six of the American leaders she met during her long life offer remembrances of her and their encounters.

title: Your Friday Briefing: Queen Elizabeth II Dies at 96
description: Plus the Solomon Islands postpones its election and tycoons leave China.

title: 9 Books About Queen Elizabeth II
description: Elizabeth, famously reticent during her decades in the public eye, was a source of fascination for many. These books offer a deeper understanding of her life, family and world.

title: Mourning Queen Elizabeth II, in Photos
description: The death of the queen marks the loss of a revered monarch, the only one most Britons have ever known.

title: Britain’s National Anthem Will Become ‘God Save the King’
description: Many small changes are expected in Britain in the coming weeks, but one will be only obvious only when it’s sung: For the first time since 1952, the anthem will go ‘God save the king.’

title: Hurricane Kay Veers Close to Baja California’s Western Coast
description: Kay is the closest hurricane to hover near Southern California in more than two decades, the National Weather Service said.

title: Conditions at Zaporizhia Nuclear Plant Get ‘Worse and Worse and Worse’
description: Cut off from the country’s electric grid, the plant is relying on an emergency measure that it is not designed to keep up for long, the head of Ukraine’s national energy company said.

title: Charles Ascends to a Role He Has Prepared for All His Life: King
description: Once an awkward, self-doubting young man, he takes the throne, at 73, as a self-assured, gray-haired eminence.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: A Life in Photos
description: Elizabeth took her first steps in a world we recognize only from sepia photographs, and became Britain’s longest-reigning monarch. Here are a selection of images from her life.

title: Queen Elizabeth II and the Shape of 20th-Century Power Dressing
description: The longest-serving British monarch let her clothes do the talking for her.

title: Operation London Bridge: What Happens After Queen Elizabeth’s Death
description: The death of Queen Elizabeth II has set in motion a meticulously choreographed process — known as Operation London Bridge — that the palace, and the nation, has spent decades planning.

title: Failure to Slow Warming Will Set Off Climate ‘Tipping Points,’ Scientists Say
description: As global warming passes certain limits, dire changes will probably become irreversible, the researchers said, including the loss of polar ice sheets and the death of coral reefs.

title: Failure to Slow Warming Will Set Off Climate ‘Tipping Points,’ Scientists Say
description: As global warming passes certain limits, dire changes will probably become irreversible, the researchers said, including the loss of polar ice sheets and the death of coral reefs.

title: Queen Elizabeth II Dies at 96; Was World’s Longest-Reigning Monarch
description: She ruled over Britain for nearly seven decades, unshakably committed to the rituals of her role amid epic social and economic change and family scandal.

title: Macron Aims for a National Dialogue in France, but Faces No-Shows
description: The inaugural meeting of a council to examine France’s most pressing problems had an issue of its own: boycotts.

title: Where Is Balmoral Castle?
description: Her family says Queen Elizabeth is happiest at the sprawling estate, her primary summer residence.

title: CIA Director Said Putin’s Ukraine Invasion Looks Like a ‘Failure’
description: William J. Burns said that counterattacks in the south and northeast showed that President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia had underestimated Ukraine’s capacity for combat.

title: The Queen’s Son Prince Charles Is First in Line to Succeed Her
description: As her health has declined, Queen Elizabeth II has delegated more of her royal duties to her son.

title: ‘London Bridge Is Down’: The Plan in Place for the Queen’s Death
description: The plan includes guidance on major logistical issues, and smaller details like the protocol for lowering flags.

title: Live Updates: Queen Elizabeth II Under Medical Supervision as Health Concerns Grow
description: The queen, who is 96, has not been hospitalized and remains at Balmoral Castle, her estate in the Scottish Highlands, Buckingham Palace said in a statement.

title: Philippines Rebuffs International Court Over Duterte’s War on Drugs
description: The Marcos government rejected a request to let prosecutors resume an inquiry into former President Rodrigo Duterte’s drive against crime, which left thousands dead.

title: Truss Takes Office in Time-Honored British Fashion
description: The transfer of power from the outgoing prime minister, Boris Johnson, was accomplished in a pair of meetings with the queen.

title: Queen Elizabeth II Under Medical Supervision as Health Concerns Grow
description: The queen, who is 96, has not been hospitalized and remains at Balmoral Castle, her estate in the Scottish Highlands, Buckingham Palace said in a statement.

title: Captured UK Aid Worker Paul Urey’s Body Shows Signs of Torture, Ukraine Says
description: Paul Urey was charged with mercenary activities by a pro-Russian separatist group, which claimed he died in July from illness and stress.

title: Liz Truss, New U.K. Leader, Lays Out Energy Price Cap Plan
description: Facing severe economic headwinds, the prime minister, on her third day in office, announced emergency measures to freeze gas and electricity rates.

title: Covid’s Toll on Native Americans
description: Covid’s death toll in Indigenous communities has no modern precedent.

title: Blinken Visits Kyiv and Announces More Military Aid for Ukraine
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the U.S. intended to send another $2 billion in long-term support to Ukraine and other countries in the region.

title: China’s Zero-Covid Approach Explained
description: The country where the coronavirus first emerged is committed to going to great lengths to stop its spread.

title: Twilight of Entrepreneurs in China as More Leave the Country
description: Two of China’s best-known entrepreneurs, Pan Shiyi and Zhang Xin, stepped down from their top jobs at the real estate development company they built.

title: Iraq’s Instability Deepens Amid Political Paralysis and Clashes
description: Politicians have failed to form a new government nearly a year after the last elections. Baghdad just saw its worst militia clashes in years. And despite vast oil wealth, the state can’t provide basic services.

title: Climate Change Could Worsen Supply Chain Turmoil
description: A drought that has crippled economic activity in southwestern China hints at the kind of disruption that climate change could wreak on global supply chains.

title: Fire at a Karaoke Bar in Vietnam Kills 33
description: An electrical problem set off the latest in a string of fatal blazes at entertainment venues in the country.

title: Solomon Islands’ Leader, a Friend of China, Gets an Election Delayed
description: The prime minister claims the country can’t afford to hold national elections next year. His opponents see a power grab linked to Beijing’s influence.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Vladimir Putin’s energy influence in Europe.

title: In Ukraine, a Beekeeper Hunkers Down With His ‘Frontline Bees’
description: With nearby sunflower fields unplanted and rockets overhead, a Ukrainian’s bees ventured toward the battlefront and returned with a bumper crop.
